text.__SUMMARY__: Shorea bracteolata is a species of plant in the Dipterocarpaceae family.  The species name bracteolata is derived from Latin (bracteolatus = with bracteoles) and refers to the persistent bracteoles of the inflorescence.
text.Description: S. bracteolata is an emergent tree, up to 50 m, found in mixed dipterocarp forests on well-drained clay and sandy soils. It is found in Sumatra, Peninsular Malaysia, Singapore and Borneo.
text.Wood:
It is threatened by habitat loss. The timber is a light hardwood sold under the trade name White Meranti.
